alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 2:31AM CST until February 26 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Near bankfull conditions and flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Illinois, including the following county, La Salle. * WHEN...Until noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 AM CST, emergency management reported that some ice had broken free from an ice jam near the Dayton Dam. Some of this ice was recollecting downstream along the Fox River in Ottawa. Minor flooding of the Fox River Park had been reported. In addition, there remains a large amount of ice upstream of the Dayton Dam up to Wedron. With ongoing river rises due to Tuesday`s rainfall, there may continue to be some immediate riverside flooding of low-lying areas due to ice jams. - If any solid ice jams are reported that would induce greater flooding, a river Flood Warning for the lower Fox River will be issued. - Some river locations that may experience minor flooding include... Ottawa, Sheridan, Serena, Millington, Dayton and Wedron. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
